review_title: Quality place filled with caring team members
pros: Good place to work. Good people that help each other. Morale is high among employees.
cons: Small community hospital that could benefit from having more physicians available

review_title: Family-like among coworkers until new hospital built; then backstabbing and major butt-licking.
pros: Wonderful benefits and the patients for the most part were receptive to education and info from the RNs.
cons: Senior management would not listen to workers about problems with managers, or the middle management did not pass along problems between workers and immediate managers.  Middle-management did not want upper mangement to know of any problems so it made them look good.  Quite a few excellent nurses left or were forced out.  These were nurses with years of experience.  You could build up a large amount of PLB (paid leave bank); but when you wanted to use it, you were told "we will be short handed if you take days off".  Upper management always sided with doctors whenever there was an issue with the nurse and doctor--no matter who was actually right.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Port Saint John, FL
pros: Sweet HR when hired, but beware all front!
cons: Major clicks and if your not in it, your bullied until you quit and or fired! Promised promotions and raises, NEVER received! People less qualified, however friends with mgmt are promoted. Open door policy regarding issues is a joke! Whatever problem you have, is NEVER kept confidential! Trust all staff will know you complained about a ligament problem, and who it was about! They never have your back, even if like myself have great reviews can be disregarded like trash! I worked there for 5yrs, NO write ups 4.5 out of 5 on my reviews and was bullied by staff until I had no choice but to leave! Worked 40plus hours praised, always came to for help by other staff including managers, and left with NOTHING but broken promises! STAY AWAY!!! Health First is the place!!!!

pros: Since they are the only hospital in titusville---I guess I would say to make money
cons:
I worked in Home health as a traveling PT.  I found the nurses to be old school and are not very rehab orientatated as well.
The director is very fake person, though appears friendly on the outside.  The office staff are very nosey and are huge busy bodies.  Once, when my drivers license was expiring I recieved a call from 1 of the busy bodies asking me if I had renewed it.  They must have gone through my file and wrote the expiration day down on their calender months in advance.
The management in home health, like to talk down to the employees and keep them under their thumb.  They always asume the worst in you and are constantly checking up on you.  The managment doesnt work in the field, except when they decide they need to come out and harass you for some ridiculous company policies.  Most of the talented nice nurses end up leaving them because they can't stomach them for too long.  They have you performing so many ridiculous company rules that you either get burned out or give lousy care.  Since I don't give lousy care, out the windows go the policies.  Then, they make you feel like a dirt bag while they stuff their faces with cake/goodies in the office.  I respect religious people but not when they force you to get in on their act.  At Parrish (including the hospital) they make you read these stupid godly healing stories.  They also make you repeat the really lame parrish sayings outloud.  They seem to think they are the only ones who can give good health care.

review_title: Great community but extremely overworked, understaffed, and underpaid
pros:
Health and Fitness Center free membership
The ability to learn new things every day
The friendly community at PMC
cons: Understaffed departments, high turnover, poor salary,  overworked care partners, poor communication department, and constant changes or poor decisions by the Executive Management Team.

job_title: RN Charge Nurse in Titusville, FL
pros: Smaller hospital meaning you get to know all of your coworkers. They always offer opportunities to go further in your career and you can also switch to different departments to gain more experience. They also offer a cutting edge graduate nurse program for nurses coming out of nursing school.
cons: The benefits aren’t equally accommodating for everyone and you can only see doctors and go are within the network. Most places I go to haven’t even heard of our insurance.

pros: Parrish is one of the largest employers in Brevard County, however, there is a lack of people skills present in some of the supervisors. They pay well and have excellent benefits.
cons: Human Resources lets Department Supervisors handle the disciplinary duties, what that means is that there is no eversite for the Supervisor and no recourse for the terminated employee.

pros: Plenty of hours, stable shift, great about getting paid on time
cons: Never a pay raise, what you start out as is what you get until you quit, they DO NOT care about their employees, they are never truthful. They told me I was working close to home but yet they bounced me from Titusville to Melbourne without gas and travel time.They sent me a text at 3am to tell me where I was going the next day.Horrible place to work for. Please stay far away from this company
